verb-ama  -- static (position/posture) [ex]: fungama, skiama, inama, zama, kingama, achama, tuama
verb-ata  -- contactive, tenacious (expresses contact) [ex]: kamata, kumbata, fumbata, ambata
verb-ga  -- casual / relaxed action	__ tunawasubiri wageni wakiwaaga. (we are waiting for the guests to leave.)
verb-ga  -- certain future action	__ kesho nakuwaga kusafiri. (i will definitely travel tomorrow.)
verb-ga  -- contrary surprise	__ vipi naendaga nikivaa matambara haya? (how can i go wearing these rags?)
verb-ga  -- emphatic punch	__ umeona gari ile kubwa? ilikujaga kwa kasi sana! (did you see that big car? it came very quickly!)
verb-ga  -- habitual action	__ nakujaga nyumbani saa kumi na mbili. (i usually come home at twelve o'clock.)
verb-ga  -- hypothetical / contrary action	__ ningekuwaga tajiri, ningeishi maisha ya kifahari. (if i were rich, i would live a luxurious life.)
verb-ga  -- polite / tentative action	__ ningependaga kuja kwako. (i would like to come to your house.)
verb-ga  -- repeated / ongoing action	__ watu wanazugazaga hapa kila siku. (people are loitering here every day.)
verb-ga  -- TZ slang adds emphasis, punch	__ vipi anakujaga TZ? mimi sinaga aibu!

-bandua chali  -- boasting about wealth or possessions ["uncover the ribs"]  (slang)
-cheka na meno  -- boasting with arrogance ["laugh with teeth"]  (slang)
-chekelea  -- mock or boast in a playful way
-faragua  -- boast excessively, brag openly [emphasizes public and excessive boasting] (slang)	__ anafaragua tuzo zake mbele ya kila mtu.
-jibodoa  -- boast arrogantly, show off [implies arrogance and showing off rather than just boasting]	__ yeye mjanja sana, daima hujibodoa na uwezo wake.
-jifaharisha  -- take pride in oneself, boast openly [similar to "jisifu" but with more emphasis on outward expression]	__ watoto wake wamejifaharisha kwa matokeo mazuri.
-jifaragua  -- feel proud of oneself, boast subtly [focuses on the internal feeling of pride with a subtler expression]; ringa, jifaharisha	__ amejifaragua baada ya kupandishwa cheo. kuutazama mwezi uliojifaragua angani.
-jifutua  -- boast about wealth or possessions [specifically focused on materialistic boasting]	__ anajifutua na magari yake ya kifahari. anapenda kujifutua kwamba yeye ni mzuri.
-jigamba  -- boast loudly, proclaim achievements [neutral term for loud and open boasting]	__ ameshinda mashindano na kujigamba kwa kila mtu. haifai kujigamba mbele za watu.
-jigamba na x  -- boast about something specific	__ jigamba na ushindi wake
-jiheshimu  -- self-respect, can sometimes overlap with boasting about one's own qualities  
-jiinamia  -- boast about oneself, admire oneself [implies self-admiration alongside boasting]	__ yeye hujiinamia sana uzuri wake.
-jinaki  -- make fun of oneself in a boastful way [boasting through self-deprecation, often ironic or sarcastic]	__ anajinaki na umaskini wake kana kwamba tajiri.
-jipiga kifua  -- signifies boasting confidently and openly ["beat one's chest"]
-jirusha  -- throw [figuratively to boast about throwing money around]
-jirusha maneno  -- boasting or talking big ["throw words"]
-jirusha mkwanja  -- boasting about spending money freely ["throw coins"]  (slang)
-jisifu  -- boast, praise oneself openly [neutral term for praising oneself, though can be negative in excess]	__ mwalimu anajisifu kwa wanafunzi wake.
-jisifu-sifu  -- repeatedly boast or praise oneself [similar to "jisifu" but more emphatic]
-jitapa  -- boast arrogantly, brag about oneself [carries strong negative connotation of arrogance and exaggeration]	__ yeye hujitapa kila mara hata hana uwezo.
-jivuna  -- be arrogant and boastful, look down on others [implies looking down on others while boasting]	__ yeye hujivuna kwa sababu ana pesa nyingi.
-koga  -- boast subtly, brag indirectly [boasting through hints and indirect suggestions]	__ anakogezana na kazi zake nzuri.
-kuimba sifa zake  -- directly indicates boasting ["sing one's own praises"]  (idm)
-kujiviringisha  -- implies boasting excessively and shamelessly ["to roll oneself"]  (idm)
-kujivuna na manyoya  -- signifies boasting about external attributes ["be proud of one's feathers"]  (idm)
-kukaa juu ya pembe  -- being proud and boasting about one's achievements ["sit on the horns"]  (idm)
-mbabe  -- swagger, implies boasting through confident or arrogant behavior ["hero, strong man"]  (slang)
-mea mbawa  -- boast openly and loudly, brag excessively [similar to "jigamba" but with additional negativity for excessiveness]	__ yeye humea mbawa na nguvu zake.
-onja asali  -- used figuratively to brag about one's achievements or good fortune ["taste honey"]
-pandisha sauti  -- raise one's voice [signifies loud and confident boasting] 
-pompo  -- excessive and self-aggrandizing boasting  (slang)
-randa  -- roam, wander, also used figuratively to boast (rare) [very rare figurative usage, not common in everyday speech]	__ maneno yake yanaranda kila mahali.
-rinda  -- swagger, strut, walk proudly [implies confidence through physical action, not necessarily verbal boasting]	__ anajirusha rinda akiongea na watu.
-shaua  -- boast, brag playfully [lighthearted and playful boasting, often among children]	__ watoto wanashauana wacheze nao.
-tega domo  -- metaphor for bragging to attract attention or admiration ["set a trap" ]

dumisha tabia njema  -- maintain good behavior	__ dumisha tabia njema popote uendapo.
mtazamo wenye upendeleo unaoibuka kibinafsi  -- subjective, personal, biased, interpretive; inahusiana na au huathiriwa na hisia, mitazamo, au uzoefu wa mtu binafsi; mara nyingi bila kujua huathiriwa na upendeleo unaoibuka kibinafsi, na hivyo kusababisha taswira potofu ya ukweli ambayo hutofautiana kutoka mtu hadi mtu	__ kila mtu ana mtazamo wenye upendeleo unaoibuka kibinafsi kuhusu uzuri.
mtazamo mhalisi unaotegemea ukweli au busara  -- objective, factual, impartial, unbiased, verifiable; inahusiana na ukweli na mambo huru kutoka kwa hisia au upendeleo wa kibinafsi; inategemea ukweli halisi, akili, na mantiki, na inatoa uelewa unaothibitishwa na unaofanana kwa waangalizi wote	__ ripoti hii inatoa mtazamo mhalisi unaotegemea ukweli au busara wa hali halisi.
uchapukaji  -- promptness [quickness, diligence in action]; hali ya kuwa mwepesi na tayari kufanya jambo bila kuchelewa, au bidii katika kazi	__ uchapukaji ndio ishara ya kwanza ya uwajibikaji.
msaada wa kisheria  -- legal aid	__ uzinduzi wa kampeni ya msaada wa kisheria
cheti cha kifo  -- death certificate  (law)
rita  -- registration, insolvency and trusteeship agency (rita)
mazao ya damu  -- blood donation
-anza na mambo gani  -- what are essential first steps?, where to begin? [request for guidance/roadmap]; eleza hatua za kwanza za msingi za kuanzisha au kufanya jambo	__ ukitaka kuanza biashara, unajua kuanza na mambo gani?
verb-e {subjunctive}  --  intention, requirement, or recommendation
maelezo ya jumla  -- general concept
direct  -- direct, straightforward; bila kupinda-pinda au kuzunguka-zunguka, fika moja kwa moja kwenye lengo au kusudio	__ wazo uende direct.
-fikiri  -- think, reason, calculate [objective, rational]; tumia akili kuchambua, kutatua, au kuelewa jambo	__ tunafikiri tunavyofanya kazi zetu.
-waza  -- ponder, muse, worry [subjective, musing]; tumia ubongo kwa kutatua matatizo au kuelewa zaidi jambo; tia katika ubongo; fikiri	__ anawaza sana kuhusu matatizo yake.
-aza  -- think, plan briefly [concise, future-oriented]; fikiria haraka au kwa juujuu mara nyingi kuhusu jambo la baadaye	__ nawaaza nifanye nini sasa.
-jiaza  -- muse to oneself, contemplate privately; kufikiria jambo kimyakimya mwenyewe	__ alijiaza jinsi ya kutatua tatizo hilo.
-dhani  -- suppose, assume, imagine [belief, conjecture]; fikiria jambo bila uhakika kamili; shuku, fikiri, tuhumu, fikiria, hesabu	__ nadhani mvua itanyesha leo. kwa nini unadhani kwamba shangazi yako hatafika leo?
-onelea  -- be of the opinion, perceive [perceived viewpoint]; kuwa na maoni au hitimisho binafsi kuhusu jambo	__ sisi tunaonelea kuwa ni bora kuivunja safari yetu.
-taamali  -- contemplate, reflect deeply [philosophical insight]; kutafakari jambo kwa kina na utulivu, mara nyingi kwa kutafuta uelewa wa kiroho au falsafa	__ mzee alikaa akitaamali maisha yake. daktari alitaamali juu ya operesheni ngumu atakayomfanyia mgonjwa wake.
-tafakari  -- ponder deeply, deliberate [introspective]; kufikiria jambo kwa uangalifu na kwa muda mrefu kabla ya kufanya uamuzi	__ kabla ya kujibu, alitafakari kwa muda mrefu.
-tafakuri  -- taz tafakari: meditate, reflect
mwazo  {mi}  -- act, process of thinking
mwaza  {wa}  -- sby who thinks, ponders
-wazia  -- intend, plan for, think about; kuwa na nia au mpango juu ya jambo au mtu	__ nimewazia kumshinda.
